definition: to resort to tricks/to act in a slippery way/to try to evade (work, responsibility)
surname Shua
to play with/to wield/to act (cool etc)/to display (a skill, one's temper etc)
surname Hua
to slip/to slide/smooth/slippery/cunning
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]

sentences.english: We can't trust a person who often plays fast and loose.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能信任一個經常耍滑頭的人。

sentences.english: When liu town gimmick, lai with ginger both smoke to deal with the wound.
sentences.chinese: 柳時鎮耍滑頭，賴着姜暮煙爲自己處理傷口。

sentences.english: Shuagushihuai who will not only gentlemanly disdain it.
sentences.chinese: 耍滑使壞誰不會，只是君子不屑爲之。

sentences.english: Although your co-workers are trying to be forthright now, you're leery about your boss.
sentences.chinese: 雖然現在你的同事想要坦白，你卻對你的老闆耍滑頭。

sentences.english: Don't play tricks. I won't fall in your traps.
sentences.chinese: 你不要耍滑頭，我不會上你的當。

sentences.english: Nobody dares to play trick on him.
I played fox several times, pretending illness.
sentences.chinese: 我有幾次耍滑頭，假裝有病。

sentences.english: “But I am at the doctor’s right now,” he pleaded.
sentences.chinese: “可我正在醫生那兒，”他又耍滑頭了。

sentences.english: He could hardly believe that his best friend had come the double on him.
sentences.chinese: 他簡直不相信他最好的朋友在對他耍滑頭。

definition: see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
to get smart/to resort to petty tricks
to shy away from work/to get by without attending duty
variant of 奸猾[jian1 hua2]
crafty/slippery/slyboots
to play tricks/to maneuver
toadying for personal gain/to curry favor/to study in great depth
to make a living doing manual labor/to give sth all one's got
to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
to swindle/to cheat
to idle on the job
to work half-heartedly/to get by in a job with the minimum effort
to resort to bragging and flattering
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
